summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It authenticates transcripts of two depositions of Maxwell taken in 2016 and agrees they may be received as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose deposition transcripts from 2016 are being authenticated for use as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is a signatory to this stipulation on behalf of the government.

persons.name: Christopher Everdell
persons.context: An attorney representing defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as a signatory to this stipulation.

events.title: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell was taken in New York, New York. The transcript is being authenticated as evidence.

events.title: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A second deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell was taken in New York, New York. The transcript is being authenticated as evidence.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate to the authenticity of Maxwell's 2016 deposition transcripts for use as evidence at her criminal trial.

keyFacts: The document authenticates transcripts from two depositions of Ghislaine Maxwell taken on April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016.
The stipulation, dated November 2021, was filed in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330).
The authenticated deposition transcripts were marked for trial as Government Exhibit 1008.
The stipulation is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and Maxwell's four defense attorneys.
This filing indicates the prosecution intended to use Maxwell's own prior sworn testimony against her at trial.
